page.shortlink: Open a Report, Label or Letter layout
page.topic: Open a Report, Label or Letter layout
page.description: Displays a report, label or letter layout as a PDF file using the Acrobat PDF reader. The report is displayed in either a pop-up window or in a DIV on the current page.

section.description: Used with the Grid and UX component

item.name: Report name
item.description: Specify the report (Report, Label or Letter) name.

description.p: Specify if the report should be rendered as as a PDF document, or as HTML. (For best performance, HTML is recommended for 'Layout Table' reports)
IMPORTANT: The 'HTML' option is NOT SUPPORTED for 'Letters', 'Labels' and 'Reports' that are not designed using the 'Layout Table' editor. Choices include *[ui:PDF]*, *[ui:HTML]*, *[ui:HTML-Paged]*.

item.name: Filter
item.description: Specify if the report should be filtered. (This filter is in addition to any filter that was defined as part of the report layout).

item.name: Order
item.description: Specify the report order. If you specify an order here it will override the order defined in the report layout.

description.p: Specify if the report should be filtered. This filter must be defined using SQL syntax. It is executed on the Database Server. (This filter is in addition to any filter that was defined as part of the report layout).
If the report is being created in a Grid component, you can use the function *[xb:currentGridFilter()]* to filter the Report using the Grid filter.
If the report is being created for a List control, you can use the function *[xb:currentListFilter("LIST_NAME")]* to filter the Report using the List's filter.
Specify the report order. If you specify an order here it will override the order defined in the report layout.
You can use the function *[xb:currentGridOrder()]* to order the Report using the Grid order.
If the report is being created for a List control, you can use the function *[xb:currentListOrder("LIST_NAME")]* to order the Report using the List's order.

item.name: Local Filter
item.description: The local filter is executed after the data is retrieved from the SQL database. This filter must be specified using Xbasic syntax. If possible, you should use a SQL Filter in preference to a Local Filter - it is much more efficient.

item.name: Local Order
item.description: The local order is applied after the data is retrieved from the SQL database. This order must be specified using Xbasic syntax.

item.name: PDF Options
item.description: PDF Options property.

item.name: Local argument definitions
item.description: Local argument definitions property.

item.name: Argument bindings
item.description: Argument bindings property.

item.name: PDF open parameters
item.description: Specify parameter to control how the PDF is displayed when it is initially rendered. You can set properties such as the zoom level. Not all PDF readers support these properties.

item.name: Has window close button
item.description: If checked, displays a close button on the window toolbar for the HTML report. It is recommended to add a close button if the Window title bar has been turned off.

item.name: Close button text
item.description: The text shown in the close button. This property is only available if *[ui:Has window close button]* has been checked.

item.name: Print as PDF
item.description: Show a button on the HTML Report viewer to make a callback and render the report as a PDF document.

item.name: Export to Excel
item.description: Show a button to export the Report to Excel

item.name: Export to Word
item.description: Show a button to export the Report to Word

item.name: Export to Text
item.description: Show a button to export the Report to text file

item.name: Print
item.description: Show a button to print the HTML report.

item.name: Report Bookmarks button type
item.description: If the report you are viewing has bookmarks, the bookmarks are shown in a Panel. If the report container is too narrow to show the Bookmarks Panel, the Panel is automatically collapsed, and a button is shown to display the Bookmarks Panel. Specify the button style. Choices include *[ui:Text]*, *[ui:Image]*.

item.name: Report Bookmarks button text
item.description: Specify the text for the Bookmarks button.

item.name: Report Bookmarks button image
item.description: Specify the text for the Bookmarks button.

item.name: Report Bookmarks panel width
item.description: Specify the width for the Bookmarks Panel. Use CSS syntax (not %). If there is insufficient space to show the Panel, it will be automatically collapsed and can then be shown by clicking on the Bookmarks button.

item.name: Maximum records to display
item.description: Specify the maximum number of records to display in the HTML report. Enter 0 to see all records. Limiting the number of records will allow the report to display faster.

item.name: 'More records' message
item.description: Specify the message to show if there are more records in the report than the number in the display limit. The message will not show if the total records in the report is less that the number set in the display limit. [DisplayRecords] is a placeholder for the number of records to display. [TotalRecords] is a placeholder for the total number of records in the report.

item.name: 'More records' message container style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the container that holds the 'More records' message.

section.title: Target Window, DIV, Tabbed UI Pane or Panel Properties

item.name: Target
item.description: Specify if the report should be opened in a pop-up window, a DIV on the page, a Panel or (if the component is running in a Tabbed UI) in a new Tabbed UI pane. (If you choose the 'Tabbed UI Pane' option, and the component is not running inside a Tabbed UI, it will be opened in a modeless pop-up window). Choices include.

item.name: Target Panel
item.description: Specify the Panel Id.

item.name: Target DIV ID
item.description: Specify the ID of the target DIV. This DIV can be in the Grid component (for example, in a free-form edit region), or on the .a5w page that contains the Grid component. TIP: If you want to specify a DIV that is inside a freeform edit region in a Grid cell, use the '{grid.rowID}' placeholder in the DIV id. For example: 'div1_Row{grid.rowID}'. This will ensure that each row has a uniquely named DIV in which the target page can be displayed.

item.name: Parent Panel Navigator
item.description: Specify the Id of the parent Panel Navigator. The dynamic Panel will be added to this Panel Navigator.

item.name: Dynamic Panel Title
item.description: Specify the title for the Dynamic Panel.

item.name: User can close dynamic panel
item.description: (Only applies if the target Panel Navigator has been configured to use a Tab Band) Specify if the label for the dynamically added Panel has a 'close' icon that allows the user to close the dynamically added Panel.

item.name: Working message placement
item.description: Specify the panel where the wait message should be shown. You should chose a Panel that is currently visible, not a Panel that will be animated into view when the component is rendered.

item.name: Working message uses CSS3 animation?
item.description: Specify if the working message should be displayed using a CSS3 animation?

item.name: Working message animation size
item.description: Specify the size of the animation in pixels.

item.name: Can hide target DIV?
item.description: Specify the DIV can be hidden (to remove from view the target page after it has been opened in the DIV).

item.name: DIV hide hyperlink
item.description: Specify text for the hyperlink that hides the DIV where the target page is shown.

item.name: Target IFrame style
item.description: The target page will be opened in an IFrame inside the target DIV. Specify the inline style for the IFrame. You can set the IFrame's height and width in the style.

item.name: Report height
item.description: Specify the height of the report. The report container DIV will be resized to this height. Use CSS units.

item.name: Report width
item.description: Specify the width of the report. The report container DIV will be resized to this height. Use CSS units.

item.name: Window name
item.description: Set to <Default> to give the window a default name. If you give the window an explicit name (which must be unique), then you can easily get a pointer to the window to execute methods of the window object. Click the smart field for tips on how to name your window and for information on how to get a pointer to the window object.

item.name: Window type
item.description: Specify the window type. Popup windows will show in a moveable window on the page. Dropdown windows have no title bar and cannot be moved. By default, Dropdown windows open directly below the control that you click to open the window. Note: An Ajax window will NOT be blocked by a browser's internal protection against popup windows.

item.name: Lock overlay CSS class name
item.description: Specify the CSS class name to use for the overlay that is displayed behind the window. The overlay prevents the user from clicking on controls that are outside the window. Leave blank, or specify <Default> to use the default style. Specify <Invisible> to create an invisible overlay (has no color, but user is still prevented from clicking on controls off the window). By specifying a class that has a 'background' attribute, you can control the color of the overlay. For example: background: rgba(0,0,0,0) to create a transparent overlay.

item.name: Sub-theme
item.description: (Optional) Specify a sub-theme for the window. The sub-theme can select a different pre-defined window 'look'. If you leave this property blank the 'base' sub-theme is automatically selected.

item.name: Dock window
item.description: Docked windows 'stick' to an edge of the screen and remain in place even when the page is scrolled.

item.name: Dock location
item.description: Specify which edge of the screen the window is docked to. Choices include *[ui:Left]*, *[ui:Right]*, *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*.

item.name: Window position
item.description: Specify where the window will be shown.

item.name: Re-use existing window
item.description: Specify if multiple modeless windows can be opened, or only a single modeless window.

item.name: Window title
item.description: Specify the window title. The window title can contain data from fields in the current record. Enclose field values in curly braces. E.g. Customer - {lastname}. To reference values from a column in a List control use this syntax: {LIST::ListName::ColumnName} (e.g. {LIST::MYLIST1::LASTNAME} )

item.name: Window title show
item.description: Specify if the window title should be shown or hidden.

item.name: Window title position
item.description: Specify if the window title should appear at the top or bottom of the window. Choices include *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*.

item.name: Window title direction
item.description: Specify if the direction is 'ltr' (left-to-right) (title on left, close button on right) or 'rtl' (right-to-left) (close button on left and title on right). Choices include *[ui:ltr]*, *[ui:rtl]*.

item.name: Window title has close button
item.description: Specify if the window title has a Close button.

item.name: Disable window move
item.description: Specify if the window cannot be moved by the user.

item.name: Pane title
item.description: Specify the tab pane title. The pane title can contain data from fields in the current record. Enclose field values in curly braces. E.g. Customer - {lastname}. To reference values from a column in a List control use this syntax: {LIST::ListName::ColumnName} (e.g. {LIST::MYLIST1::LASTNAME} )

item.name: Window height
item.description: Specify the window height. Use CSS syntax. For example: 3in, 10cm, 200px. If you do not set the height, the window will resize automatically to accommodate the window contents.

item.name: Window width
item.description: Specify the window height. Use CSS syntax. For example: 3in, 10cm, 200px. If you do not set the width, the window will resize automatically to accommodate the window contents.

item.name: Window is resizable
item.description: If checked, the user can resize the window.

item.name: Working message
item.description: Specify the text of the message to show in the window while the window waits for its contents to be generated. You can use this placeholder in the message: {reportName}

item.name: Working message icon
item.description: Specify the image to show in the window while the window waits for its contents to be generated.

item.name: Client-side file name
item.description: Specify the default filename on the user's computer (when they download the file). If you leave this blank, the filename of the server will be used as the default client-side filename.

item.name: Xbasic function
item.description: Specify the name of the Xbasic function to call after the report has been created.

item.name: DIV Id for progress messages
item.description: Specify the ID of a DIV where the 'working...' message, and any error messages, should be shown. This DIV can be in the Grid component (for example, in a free-form edit region), or on the .a5w page that contains the Grid component. TIP: If you want to specify a DIV that is inside a freeform edit region in a Grid cell, use the '{grid.rowID}' placeholder in the DIV id. For example: 'div1_Row{grid.rowID}'. This will ensure that each row has a uniquely named DIV in which the messages can be displayed.

item.name: Has pointer icon
item.description: Specify if the window has a pointer icon that points to the element that was clicked to show the window.

item.name: Pointer position
item.description: Specify the window edge that has the pointer icon. If you select 'Auto' the most appropriate edge is automatically selected. Choices include *[ui:Auto]*, *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*, *[ui:Left]*, *[ui:Right]*.

item.name: Has custom toolbar buttons
item.description: Specify if the window has custom buttons in the window toolbar (at the bottom of the window).

item.name: Define buttons
item.description: Define the buttons that appear in the window toolbar (at the bottom of the window).

item.name: Buttons in-line style
item.description: In-line style for the buttons. TIP: To display the buttons left justified, enter an in-line style of: text-align:left;

item.name: Show top bar
item.description: Specify if a top bar should be shown. (Displayed above the window body inside the body container).

item.name: Top bar HTML
item.description: Specify the HTML to show in the top bar.

item.name: Top bar style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

item.name: Show bottom bar
item.description: Specify if a top bar should be shown. (Displayed below the body inside the body container).

item.name: Bottom bar HTML
item.description: Specify the HTML to show in the top bar.

item.name: Bottom bar style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

item.name: Show header
item.description: Specify if a header should be shown. (Displayed above the window body inside the body container).

item.name: Header HTML
item.description: Specify the HTML to show in the header.

item.name: Header style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

item.name: Show footer
item.description: Specify if a footer should be shown. (Displayed below the body, the bottom bar, and below any user-defined buttons).

item.name: Footer HTML
item.description: Specify the HTML to show in the footer.

item.name: Footer style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the footer.

item.name: Before execute event
item.description: Specify the name of a Javascript function to call before the callback is made to open the target Report. This Javascript function will take 'ro' as an input parameter. 'ro' contains all of the settings for the target Report to be opened. The purpose of this function is to allow you to override any of the properties of the passed-in 'ro' object.

item.name: After execute Javascript
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to run after the Report has been printed.

item.name: Animation
item.description: Specify if the window should be animated when it is shown or hidden. Note: If the window contains an IFrame, which in turn contains a PDF viewer, animation may not work well and should not be used.

item.name: Show animation style
item.description: Select the animation method to use when the window is shown. Fade and Slide use methods in jQuery core. Other options require jQueryUI.

item.name: Show animation speed
item.description: Specify the animation speed. You can select a pre-defined option (slow = 600 milliseconds, fast = 200 milliseconds), or you can enter an explicit value in milliseconds.

item.name: Hide animation style
item.description: Select the animation method to use when the window is closed. Fade and Slide use methods in jQuery core. Other options require jQueryUI.

item.name: Hide animation speed
item.description: Specify the animation speed. You can select a pre-defined option (slow = 600 milliseconds, fast = 200 milliseconds), or you can enter an explicit value in milliseconds.

item.name: onInitialize
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute the first time the window is shown.

item.name: onBeforeShow
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute before the window is shown.

item.name: onShow
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is shown.

item.name: onBeforeHide
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute before the window is hidden.

item.name: onHide
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is hidden.

item.name: onFocus
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window gets focus.

item.name: onMove
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is moved.

item.name: onResize
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is resized.

item.name: Offline Javascript
item.description: (Optional) Specify the Javascript to execute if the device is offline. Since the device is offline, the Ajax callback is not made. Therefore the code in the 'Ajax failed Javascript' property will not get executed.
